subject: Education
title: Social Comparison: Measuring Yourself Against Others
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Social Comparison: Measuring Yourself Against Others.

hook.text: Straight-A students transferred to elite schools often crashâ€”not in ability, but in confidence.

buildup.text: Festinger's social comparison theory says we evaluate ourselves by comparing to those around us.

discovery.text: Upward comparison can inspire or crush; downward comparison can comfort or breed complacency.

twist.text: The 'big-fish-little-pond effect': same student, different pond, completely different self-concept.

climax.text: Teaching students to compare against their own past performance protects motivation best.

punchline.text: The only fair comparison is you versus yesterday's you.

quiz.question: What is the 'big-fish-little-pond effect'?
options: A student's self-concept changes depending on the ability level of peers
Large schools always produce better academic outcomes than small ones
Students in small classes always learn faster than those in large ones
